ProjectTitle: INTERMITTENT EXOGENOUS KETOSIS DURING EXERCISE AND TRAINING: EXPLORING THE ROLE OF DE NOVO ANGIOGENESIS AND EPIGENETIC REGULATION IN MUSCULAR ADAPTATION

2. Data description
Also include the biopsies in the list of data. Do these already exist? If so, where do they come from. Or will they be collected during your research? 
In section 4 you also mention muscle and blood samples, so also include them in the list and indicate where they come from.
So your data list will contain both digital and physical data. 
7. Better is to deposit your data in a data repository, rather than to make them available upon request by mail. As suggestions for suitable repositories for your kind of data:
- imaging data: https://rdmkit.elixir-europe.org/bioimaging_data#data-publication-and-archiving
- biomolecular data: https://elixir-europe.org/platforms/data/elixir-deposition-databases
- else KU Leuven RDR (research data repository): https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr
label: good with suggestions
